article: I lived on a farm with my parents and my elder brothers and sisters when I was a little boy. We had the _ to play and run wherever we wanted to go. We often made up games just by pretending we were cowboys. Sometimes we played hide-and-seek. One of us would _ and the others would come and find him. I remember one _ I hid behind some old wood in the cottage. All was _ . I couldn't hear a sound, just the wind _ . The situation became tense because of the possibility of someone finding me, and the longer I _ , the more tense I became. At last , I heard footsteps coming down the yard. My _ beat fast and I stood _ , frozen like a block of ice. I saw my brother getting closer and closer. When he saw me, he laughed _ , shouting at the top of his voice so that _ could hear him say, "Eh, I've _ our Tommy!" I can still see the _ on his face today. Afterwards he said he didn't think I would hide there. I shrugged my shoulders and said, "Why, it's a good place, isn't it?" I don't have any _ of these events, just memories, as we had no camera at that time. _ it was a long time ago, I can see them now as if they _ yesterday. Now I live in town on a busy street. My girls don't have the freedom that we used to have to run off down the road and play whatever they want. Anyway, is it _ to let children out of sight these days?
